intro: Miconia praecox, commonly known as the early miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within rainforests. Miconia praecox is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, which can have ecological impacts in its native habitat.
